Entries.default: You find a middle-aged dwarf tied to a post, a pile of bloody refuse scattered at his feet. His beard is a matted mess, and his face is streaked with dirt. Despite his haggard state, he twists against his bonds when you approach.
"Bless your knickers, you're just in time. Another moment more'n I woulda been dinner."
"Who are you?"
[Untie him.]
[Leave.]
"Hey now, uh, can't say I blame you for wanting to leave, but could you at least untie me before you go?"

"My wrists thank ya mightily." He takes a moment to flex and bend his hands, working the circulation back into them. His lips twist into a grimace when he runs his fingers over the deep bruises the ropes left.
"It's a right sorry tale, I'm afraid to say. Our ship - a beautiful ship she was, too - ran aground in a storm. Waves so high we couldn't see a damn thing, ya understand."
"Giordu Red-Handed of the Imposter's Lament. Well, formerly of the Imposter's Lament." He laughs a little too loudly.
"As the months wore on and no one came lookin' for us, we started running low on crew and, ah, victuals. I think what few of us were left here at the end might've gone a little nutty."
[Accept his offer.] "Welcome to the crew of [Player Ship]."
"I owe ya one, captain. A debt like this - I'm not sure I'll ever be able to repay you."
"Did ya reconsider my offer?"

"You like stew? I got a great recipe - flavor's real different, like nothing you ever tasted. I'll make it for ya.

"Ya know, in thanks." He gives you a quick wink and a nod before heading back to the ship.

"Come to discover this here island's 'bout as barren as an ancient lecher's bed. Not a scrap of nothing edible on it. And none of us were especially keen to take our turn about the Wheel, so..." He trails off, unable to meet your eye.
"Something of a life-long deckhand, I am. Picked up cooking in the last few months, too. Meat's my specialty, on account of the - well, you know. The business here. With the cannibalism."
"What happened here?"
[Leave.] "You're fine where you are."
"W-wait! Please! Don't leave me here!"
"You're back! Thanks the gods, I thought I was gonna rot here!"
"That's a right dirty trick you played on me! You're a- a sadist, that's what you are!"

"Say, you got a ship - couldn't get here without one, right. You by chance have any spots open for an old dwarf like me? I might not look it, but I'm a deft hand with the rigging. Can even cook some."
"Here, take this. Least I can do is send you off with a boon, eh?" Giordu draws the cloak from his shoulders, gives it a good shake, and places it reverently in your hands.
"You take care out there."
